component.name: Input
component.description: Allow the user to enter freeform text or numeric values.

useCases: Numeric input for quantities or values
Inline editable values in data tables or settings

commonPatterns.name: form-input
commonPatterns.description: Standard text input wrapped in a Field for label and error support

commonPatterns.name: inline-editable
commonPatterns.description: Borderless inline input for editable values in data-dense layouts

commonPatterns.name: small-input
commonPatterns.description: Compact input for dense UI or inline controls

commonPatterns.name: with-input-group
commonPatterns.description: Input composed with addons via InputGroup

antiPatterns.reason: Input is a single-line element and cannot handle line breaks

antiPatterns.scenario: Using Input without a Field wrapper in forms
antiPatterns.reason: Input does not manage labels, descriptions, or error messages
antiPatterns.alternative: Wrap Input in Field for complete form semantics

antiPatterns.reason: Freeform text is harder to validate and less efficient for known option sets
antiPatterns.alternative: Use Select, RadioGroup, or Combobox for structured choices

semanticMeaning.default: Standard form input — h-9, full border and background
semanticMeaning.sm: Compact input — h-8, smaller text, for dense layouts
semanticMeaning.inline: Borderless underline-only input for inline editable values — no ring on focus, uses bottom border highlight

parentConstraints: Wrap in Field for form contexts with label and error support
Use inside InputGroup when paired with addons or buttons

interactions.focus: Background shifts from bg-secondary to bg-background; 2px ring appears
interactions.hover: No explicit hover style — defers to focus
interactions.inline-focus: Bottom border changes to primary color and thickens to 2px; background shifts to accent

responsive.mobile: Text renders at base size (16px to avoid iOS zoom)

accessibility.keyboardSupport: Tab to focus; type to enter text; standard text editing shortcuts
accessibility.screenReader: Announced as text input; requires associated label via Field or aria-label
accessibility.focusManagement: Visible 2px focus ring on focus-visible; inline variant uses underline indicator instead

rules: Input handles typing and focus only — it does not manage labels or errors
Always pair with Field in forms for proper label and error association
Use InputGroup when adding inline affordances like icons or buttons
Use the inline size only for editable values in data-dense layouts, not standard forms

aiHints.context: Use for any single-line text or numeric entry. Always wrap in Field when used in a form. For inline editable values in tables or settings, use size="inline". For inputs with icons, buttons, or addons, use InputGroup.
